cells.description: Specialized cells that transmit nerve impulses.
cells.function: Transmit signals between different parts of the brain and the nervous system.

cells.description: Supportive cells in the central nervous system.
cells.function: Support and protect neurons; maintain homeostasis.

cells.description: Star-shaped glial cells in the brain and spinal cord.
cells.function: Provide nutrients to nervous tissue, maintain blood-brain barrier.

cells.description: Glial cells that produce the myelin sheath in the central nervous system.
cells.function: Insulate axons to increase the speed of nerve impulse transmission.

cells.description: Muscle cells in the heart that are responsible for contracting and enabling the heart to pump blood.
cells.function: Generate force to pump blood through the body.

cells.description: Cells that line the blood vessels of the heart.
cells.function: Maintain vessel integrity, regulate blood flow, and prevent clotting.

cells.description: Cells that produce collagen and other fibers.
cells.function: Provide structural framework for tissues and aid in tissue repair.

cells.description: Specialized cardiomyocytes that generate electrical impulses to control the heart rate.
cells.function: Initiate and regulate the heart's rhythmic contractions.

cells.description: Main functional cells of the liver.
cells.function: Perform various functions including detoxification, protein synthesis, and production of biochemicals necessary for digestion.

cells.description: Specialized macrophages located in the liver.
cells.function: Involved in the breakdown of red blood cells and immune response.

cells.description: Cells in the liver that store vitamin A.
cells.function: Regulate blood flow in the liver and produce extracellular matrix in response to injury.

cells.description: Epithelial cells of the bile duct.
cells.function: Modify bile composition and transport bile from the liver to the gallbladder and intestine.

cells.description: Thin epithelial cells that line the alveoli.
cells.function: Facilitate gas exchange between the air and blood.

cells.description: Cuboidal cells in the alveoli that secrete surfactant.
cells.function: Reduce surface tension in the lungs and prevent alveolar collapse.

cells.description: Immune cells in the alveoli.
cells.function: Engulf and digest foreign particles, bacteria, and dead cells.

cells.description: Cells that line the blood vessels in the lungs.
cells.function: Facilitate gas exchange and maintain vascular integrity.

cells.description: Specialized cells in the Bowman's capsule of the nephron.
cells.function: Filter blood plasma in the kidneys to form urine.

cells.description: Cells that line the renal tubules.
cells.function: Reabsorb water, ions, and nutrients from the filtrate and secrete waste products into the urine.

cells.description: Cells in the kidney that release renin.
cells.function: Regulate blood pressure by controlling the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system.

cells.description: Cells around the glomerular capillaries.
cells.function: Provide structural support, regulate blood flow, and perform phagocytosis in the kidney.

cells.description: Primary cell type in the epidermis.
cells.function: Produce keratin, a protein that provides strength and waterproofing to the skin.

cells.description: Cells that produce melanin in the skin.
cells.function: Protect against UV radiation by producing pigment.

cells.description: Dendritic cells in the epidermis.
cells.function: Act as antigen-presenting cells and play a role in the immune response.

cells.description: Sensory cells in the skin.
cells.function: Detect light touch and provide sensory feedback.

cells.description: Cells in the stomach lining that secrete hydrochloric acid.
cells.function: Aid in digestion by maintaining stomach pH and activating pepsinogen.

cells.description: Cells in the stomach that secrete pepsinogen.
cells.function: Produce pepsinogen, which is converted to pepsin for protein digestion.

cells.description: Cells in the stomach that secrete the hormone gastrin.
cells.function: Stimulate acid secretion and promote stomach motility.

cells.description: Cells that produce mucus in the stomach lining.
cells.function: Protect the stomach lining from acidic gastric juices.

cells.description: Absorptive cells in the lining of the small intestine.
cells.function: Absorb nutrients and electrolytes from digested food.

cells.description: Cells that secrete mucus in the intestinal lining.
cells.function: Protect and lubricate the intestinal lining.

cells.description: Cells in the small intestine that secrete antimicrobial peptides.
cells.function: Maintain gut flora and protect against pathogens.

cells.description: Hormone-secreting cells in the intestines.
cells.function: Regulate various digestive processes by secreting hormones.

cells.description: Cells in the pancreas that produce glucagon.
cells.function: Increase blood glucose levels by stimulating glucose release from the liver.

cells.description: Cells in the pancreas that produce insulin.
cells.function: Lower blood glucose levels by facilitating glucose uptake into cells.

cells.description: Cells in the pancreas that produce somatostatin.
cells.function: Regulate the release of insulin and glucagon, and inhibit digestive processes.

cells.description: Cells in the pancreas that produce pancreatic polypeptide.
cells.function: Regulate pancreatic secretions and digestive processes.

cells.description: Immune cells located in the white pulp of the spleen.
cells.function: Filter blood and mount immune responses against pathogens.

cells.description: Cells in the red pulp of the spleen involved in blood filtration.
cells.function: Remove old or damaged red blood cells and recycle iron.

cells.description: Large phagocytic cells located in the spleen.
cells.function: Engulf and digest pathogens and debris from the blood.

cells.description: Immature T cells in the thymus.
cells.function: Undergo maturation and selection to become functional T cells.

cells.description: Cells that support the development and maturation of T cells.
cells.function: Provide a structural framework and produce signaling molecules essential for T cell maturation.

cells.description: Antigen-presenting cells in the thymus.
cells.function: Present antigens to T cells to initiate immune responses.

cells.description: Bone-forming cells.
cells.function: Synthesize and secrete the bone matrix and assist in bone mineralization.

cells.description: Mature bone cells embedded within the bone matrix.
cells.function: Maintain bone tissue and respond to mechanical stress.

cells.description: Bone-resorbing cells.
cells.function: Break down bone tissue and release minerals into the bloodstream.
